page.title: 08ENERGY IN KINGS NORTON
page.content: Our school and homes are powered by electricity and gas.Eletricity comes along insulated cables underground from the national grid.There is a sub- station.In the infant playground.The supply to the rural parts of our area is by over head cables carried on pylons.These are marked on the 25"map. Electricity is generated at power stat- ions using coal or nuclear fuel.Our nearest power station is Hams Hall which is coal fired.Natural gas comes from the North Sea.It is piped under- ground from the rings to our homes in yellow plastic pipes.We use gas for central heating boilers, gas fires cookers and some refrigerators and freezers.Electricity powers many more appliances: cookers,waterheaters,fires televisions,computer,lamp,electric bla- nkets,kettles,mixers and a record players By Teresa Shiels,Sir Theodore.
